headline.print_headline: City Defends Health Ads That Frighten the Viewer
headline.seo: Some Say New York City Health Ads Should Inspire, Not Scare
headline.main: New York City Defends Health Ads That Frighten the Viewer

docs.abstract: New York City's health department defends its use of health ads that use graphic images and scenarios to frighten the target audience, tactic that is part of the Bloomberg administration's relentless campaign to jolt New Yorkers out of bad health habits; says use of what has been criticized as a negative approach, is merely stating the hard, cold realities and scientific evidence.
docs.lead_paragraph: The city health department’s campaign to jolt New Yorkers out of their bad habits has drawn some criticism for its negative approach.
docs.snippet: The city health department’s campaign to jolt New Yorkers out of their bad habits has drawn some criticism for its negative approach.
